intro: Hauya californica, commonly known as the California hauya, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Hauya californica is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens due to its delicate appearance.
